title: Shaq Lets Restaurant Servers Dictate Their Own Generous Tips
text: Shaq Lets Restaurant Servers Dictate Their Own Generous Tips A true American hero share Shaq photo: Getty/Gabe Ginsberg. Cash photo: Thomas Trutschel NBA legend/ Kazaam star Shaquille O'Neal has a lot of money and he’s not afraid to spend it — especially when it involves tipping waiters and other people who help him out. Munchies notes that in 1997, Shaq once famously tipped a bellhop $100 for driving him to McDonald’s to get a Big Mac, and he generally offers $300 as gratuity for valet service. On Jimmy Kimmel Live last week, the basketball hero explained his philosophy on tipping in dining rooms: When I’m at restaurants, I am a big tipper. I like to show people my appreciation. So when they come up to the table I say, “The quicker I get my order, the bigger your tip will be.” And then the food will come fast. And then when we’re getting ready to leave, I’ll ask them: “ How much do you want? ” And the most someone said was $4,000 . And I said, “Okay, no problem.” Kimmel jokes that he should’ve “punched them in the head” for suggesting such a high number, but Shaq insists that he simply paid the requested gratuity, which was about two months’ worth of rent for the server. So remember bartenders and waiters: If you see Shaq sit down in your section, put a rush on his order and start tallying up how much money you need to pay off your credit card, car loan, or future vacation.
